system.description: The enchanter of the woods, these wandering spell casters resemble Rangers in their wanderlust. More comfortable with animals than people, Nature Mages are always heading to the woods and keeping to themselves. Ever in defense of the land, Nature Mages are like environmentalists. Nature Mages are in tune with the world at all times. If you are playing a Nature Mage be reclusive, avoiding people if you can, happy in nature and eager to leave any civilization.

overview.base: You may rotate between @L[Category:Nature element spells]{nature} rotator @L[Category:Spells]{spells} during a @L[Core:Short Rest]{short rest} instead of a @L[Core:Long Rest]{long rest}.
overview.proficient: You are @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{fluent} in @L[Ability:Nature Rotators]{Nature Rotators}. (This does not make you @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{fluent} in the @L[Category:Spells]{spells} themselves.)

overview.base: When you @L[Core:Attack Interaction]{attack} with @L[Ability:Empathic Ray]{Empathic Ray} or @L[Ability:Treeform Ball]{Treeform Ball}, you may target an additional creature or the same creature twice. Any costs you pay must be paid twice and be the same for both @L[Core:Attack Interaction]{attacks} These incur @L[Core:Attack Interaction]{attack penalties} as though they were two separate @L[Category:Attack abilities]{attacks}.
overview.fluent: You may instead choose up to 1 + @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{F} additional or repeated targets.

overview.base: Add @L[Ability:Advanced Hack Healing]{Advanced Hack Healing} and @L[Ability:Transmute]{Transmute} to your list of possible @L[Category:Rotator spells]{rotator spells}.

In addition to the custom rotator spells you create, you can learn @L[Category:Rotator spells]{spells} created by others. When you come across a fully created spell using only words you are @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{fluent} in, can make a DC 12 + OP @L[Core:INT]{INT} @L[Core:Feat Interaction]{feat save} to attempt to learn it. If you succeed, you can add it to your rotator spell list. If you fail, you are @L[Keyword:Incapable]{incapable} of attempting to learn that spell again. The @L[Core:GM]{GM} may modify the DC based on the spell's complexity, your knowledge of the spell, any special training you receive, if the spell's creator is there to assist you, or for any other factors they see fit. You may also attempt to learn words that you come across as long as they are of elements you are @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{fluent} in. The @L[Core:GM]{GM} may adjust the DC for these as they see fit as well, but the default is DC 15 + OP @L[Core:Intelligence]{INT} @L[Core:Feat Interaction]{feat save}.
overview.proficient: You are @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{fluent} in @L[Ability:Elder Sorcery Creation]{Elder Sorcery Creation}, @L[Ability:Celestial Elder Sorcery Words]{Celestial Elder Sorcery Words}, and @L[Ability:Nature Elder Sorcery Words]{Nature Elder Sorcery Words}.

results.save: You learn the spell or word.
results.fail: You are @L[Keyword:Incapable]{incapable} of attempting to learn that spell or word again.

overview.base:
Once per @L[Core:Short Rest]{short rest}, you may cast a @L[Category:Ritual delivery spells]{ritual} @L[Category:Nature element spells]{nature spell} in half the time it would normally take. Additionally, once per long rest, you may cast a @L[Category:Nature element spells]{nature spell} as though you were @L[Keyword:Adept]{adept} at it.

You also gain the @L[Ability:Branching Casting]{Branching} and @L[Ability:Territorial Casting]{Territorial} casting styles.
overview.proficient: You may now use the benefits from Nature Disciplines @L[Core:Proficiency Bonus]{P} times per @L[Core:Long Rest]{long rest}.
overview.fluent: You may now use the benefits from Nature Disciplines @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{F} times per @L[Core:Short Rest]{short rest}.

overview.base: Whenever you @L[Core:Healing]{heal}, you may @L[Core:Healing]{heal} a @L[Damage:Hack]{hack} as well.

Target takes the "on hit" effect of a @L[Category:Conjured spells]{conjured} @L[Category:Missile delivery spells]{missile spell} that you are @L[Core:Proficiency Bonus]{proficient} in. If the triggering hit was a critical hit, then the target takes the "on critical hit" effect instead.

system.trigger: You have just landed a hit with a @L[Category:Weapon delivery abilities]{weapon} or @L[Category:Bite delivery abilities]{bite} @L[Category:Attack abilities]{attack} on another creature and the effect has successfully applied.
system.limitation: Only usable with @L[Ability:Empathic Ray]{Empathic Ray} and @L[Ability:Treeform Ball]{Treeform Ball}.

overview.base: You may select an additional target within 30 feet of the triggering @L[Category:Spells]{spell's} original target. Your @L[Category:Spells]{spell} targets them as well. Any @L[Core:Attack Interaction]{attack rolls}, @L[Core:Feat Interaction]{feat saves}, or other necessary rolls must be made for the new target as well.

system.trigger: A @L[Category:Spells]{spell} you cast affects at least one target other than @L[Category:Self target spells]{yourself}.

overview.base: You cast a @L[Category:Single action spells]{single action spell} at the triggering creature.

system.trigger: Another creature moves within 5 feet of you.

overview.base:
The triggering @L[Category:Standard abilities]{ability} is "transformed" into a @L[Damage:Hack]{hack} instead of its normal effect. The type of the @L[Damage:Hack]{hack} is determined by the target of the triggering ability.
@L[Category:Creature target abilities]{Creature target abilities}
Transformed into a body hack.
@L[Category:Vitals target abilities]{Vitals target abilities}
Transformed into a vitals hack of your choice.
@L[Category:Arm target abilities]{Arm target abilities}
Transformed into an arm hack.
@L[Category:Leg target abilities]{Leg target abilities}
Transformed into a leg hack.
@L[Category:Limb target abilities]{Limb target abilities}
If no limb is specified in either the target or the effect, it is transformed into a limb hack of your choice.

If the triggering @L[Category:Standard abilities]{ability} was @L[Keyword:UB]{UB}, but you otherwise would have been able to @L[Ability:Basic Block]{Block} it, you may treat it as though it targeted your arm.

system.trigger: You would take a @L[Category:Standard abilities]{standard ability}.
